definition: Tibetan mastiff/also called 西藏獒犬
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect

sentences.english: In the US, Tibetan mastiff pups can be bought for as little as several hundred dollars, Feltenstein said.
sentences.chinese: 费尔滕斯坦说，在美国，区区几百美元就能买到藏獒。

sentences.english: Tibetan mastiffs are massive, fluffy status symbols there.
sentences.chinese: 藏獒很魁梧，在那里象征着路威。

sentences.english: In the US, Tibetan mastiff pups can be bought for as little as several hundred dollars, Feltenstein said。
sentences.chinese: 费尔滕斯坦说，在美国，区区几百美元就能买到藏獒。

sentences.english: Red and leonine gold mastiffs carry higher prices because they are considered rare breed.
sentences.chinese: 铁包金藏獒被认为是稀有品种，价格会更高。

sentences.english: The mastiff was generally used as a guard dog and is widely recognized as a particularly intelligent species.
sentences.chinese: 藏獒犬一般用来看家护院，也是很聪明的犬种。

sentences.english: The paradise covers 10 mu and has beautiful environment and excellent Tibetan mastiffs .
sentences.chinese: 乐园占地十亩，良好的环境饲养着优秀的纯种藏獒。

sentences.english: Fish ponds edge of the tree leash their home Tibetan mastiff .
sentences.chinese: 鱼塘边的树上拴着家里的藏獒。

definition: native dog/mole cricket (colloquial word for agricultural pest Gryllotalpa 螻蛄|蝼蛄[lou2 gu1])

pinyin: A1 la1 si1 jia1 xue3 qiao1 quan3
